## Opting Out Is Not Escapism

Opting out is often framed as withdrawal or retreat â€” a refusal to engage. In reality, opting out is one of the most engaged acts a person can take. It requires discernment, discipline, and a willingness to stand without applause. This essay challenges the idea that participation equals virtue and explores why opting out is often the first step toward building something honest.
